text.section: The Secretary may adopt regulations for the Office of the Secretary.
Before a unit in the Department publishes a proposed regulation under § 10-112 of the State Government Article, the unit shall submit the proposed regulation to the Secretary.

section.section: Except as provided in subsection (d) of this section, the Secretary may approve any proposed regulation.

Within 30 days after submission of a proposed regulation on a regulatory, supervisory, quasi-judicial, disciplinary, or enforcement function of a unit, the Secretary may disapprove the proposed regulation but only if the Secretary finds that it:
would discourage competition within a regulated occupation or profession;
would unfairly restrict entry of applicants into a regulated occupation or profession; or
otherwise is contrary to the public interest.
The Secretary may disapprove or revise any other proposed regulation.
